questions.question: What is the empirical formula of UNLPF-1 including solvent?
What is the crystal system and space group of UNLPF-1?
What is the maximum CO2 uptake capacity of UNLPF-1 at 273 K and 1.0 bar?
What is the calculated free space in fully desolvated UNLPF-1 as a percentage of the total crystal volume?
What is the density of open metal sites in UNLPF-1 per nm3?
What is the solvent accessibility percentage of UNLPF-1 compared to PCN-222?
questions.answer: UNLPF-1 has a solvent accessibility of 78.0% while PCN-222 has 79.4%

questions.question: What is the role of the axial water molecules in the paddlewheel SBUs of UNLPF-1?
questions.answer: The axial water molecules make the tube hydrophilic and upon their removal, the tubes can accommodate a column with a diameter of 8.0 Ã….

questions.question: How does the presence of an additional phenyl ring in TBCPPP contribute to the formation of eclipsed porphyrin arrays in UNLPF-1?
questions.answer: The additional phenyl ring increases the rotational flexibility of the carboxy-phenyl group, facilitating the formation of eclipsed porphyrin arrays.

questions.question: Why does UNLPF-1 exhibit high CO2 capacity and impressive selectivity for CO2 over N2?
questions.answer: The high CO2 capacity and selectivity of UNLPF-1 may be attributed to its tiny channel nature of high open metal site density upon activation.

questions.question: How does the synthesis approach of UNLPF-1 differ from that of MPFs constructed using octacarboxylate TDBPP linked by some rare SBUs?
questions.answer: UNLPF-1 is constructed from a single octacarboxylate porphyrin ligand, TBCPPP, using a common type of SBU: square paddlewheel [Zn2(COO)4(H2O)2], unlike MPFs constructed using octacarboxylate TDBPP linked by some rare SBUs.

questions.question: What is the significance of the eclipsed porphyrin arrays in UNLPF-1?
questions.answer: The eclipsed porphyrin arrays in UNLPF-1 provide an ideal prototypic structure to introduce active centers and study selective catalytic properties of the materials.

questions.question: Is UNLPF-1 the first example of a MOF with eclipsed porphyrin arrays constructed from a single linker?

Is the synthesis of UNLPF-1 achieved without the aid of additional pillaring linkers?

Is the porosity of UNLPF-1 among the highest for metalloporphyrinic frameworks?
Does the presence of an additional phenyl ring in TBCPPP decrease the rotational flexibility of the carboxy-phenyl group?
Is UNLPF-1 constructed using a rare type of SBU?
